content.title: The rise of the middle class
content.content: Thailand, for example, four out of five people are now buying their daily groceries at a modern supermarket.  That's a huge change from when I first visited there 30 odd years ago.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has been recognized as a leading asset manager in Asia.

quiz.question: Which region has more middle-class consumers?

answerInfo.title: Asia's Huge Middle
answerInfo.message: By 2025 over 70% of the world's middle class is projected to be in Asia.

quiz.source: Source: UN, World Bank, Surjit S. Bhalla, Second Among Equals: The Middle Class Kingdoms of India and China, May 2007, oxusinvestments.com

content.title: The rise of the middle class
content.content: The fall of the Soviet Union may have given the Russian people more freedom to travel abroad, but initially they didn't have the rubles to get very far.  Times have changed.  The Russians are on the move economically.  The challenge for investors is finding the best opportunities.  That can be hard to do if you're half a world away, and that's why I'm here.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has had an office in Russia since 1999.

quiz.question: Who's spending more on international tourism?

answerInfo.title: Russians are Coming
answerInfo.message: In 2010, Russians spent over $26 billion traveling outside of Russia.

quiz.source: Source: UNWTO, Tourism Highlights, 2011 edition

content.title: The rise of the middle class
content.content: We believe emerging markets are the next economic powerhouses. Some of the most competitive and profitable companies in several sectors are now based in emerging markets. The question now for investors is: Who can I work with who understands how to tap this transformation?  Franklin Templeton has paved the way with portfolio teams on the ground in developed and emerging market countries around the world who understand in depth the companies that we invest in.
content.quote: In 1993, Franklin Templeton was one of the first global firms to establish operations in India.

quiz.question: What % of the world stock market cap is from EM?

answerInfo.title: EM Have Arrived
answerInfo.message: Emerging markets represented 28% of total stock mkt cap in 2010, vs 3% in 1985.

quiz.source: Source: Standard & Poor's, Emerging Stock Markets Fact Book, 1995 and Global Stock Markets Fact Book, 2011

content.title: The rise of the middle class
content.content: Wireless communications are one of the fastest evolving industries out there. Five years ago, the buzz was around the multi-billion dollar ringtone industry. Today it’s all about apps for your smartphone. Tomorrow it may be something else, and we are focused on identifying the best opportunities as they emerge.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has offices in countries representing 83% of the world’s GDP.<sup>1</sup>

quiz.question: Who has the highest % of its pop. with a cell?

answerInfo.title: UAE Calling
answerInfo.message: 232% of the population in the UAE owns a cell phone. More than two per person!

quiz.source: Source: The World Bank (World Development Indicators), ITU (International Telecommunication Union), as of 12/31/09.

content.title: Increases in disposable income = Increases in global consumerism
content.content: People sometimes forget that global trade is a two-way street.  China’s economic growth benefits global auto manufacturers and part suppliers based in North America, Europe and Asia.  For this reason we seek undervalued companies with good long-term prospects that can benefit from global growth trends regardless of where they are located.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has local asset management teams managing domestic products in 12 countries, including China and India.

quiz.question: Where is the world’s largest car market?

answerInfo.title: China’s Autobahn
answerInfo.message: In 2010, 17.2 mil light vehicles were sold in China vs.11.6 mil in the U.S.

quiz.source: Source: India Automotive 2020: The Next Giant from Asia,” a special report published by J.D. Power and Associates, June 2011.

content.title: Increases in disposable income = Increases in global consumerism
content.content: New innovations are being adopted at an accelerating pace. The internet has changed how consumers shop, when they shop—even what they are shopping for.  Ten years ago, who would have guessed that eBooks would be outselling printed copies or that audio CDs would begin to go the way of the 8-track tape?  Part of my job is finding what’s next.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has a long-term commitment to the markets we enter. We’ve had an office in Taiwan since 1986.

quiz.question: 90% of internet users here shop online...

answerInfo.title: Taiwan Shops Online
answerInfo.message: In Taiwan 90% of internet users are clicking to add to their shopping carts.

quiz.source: Source: Nielsen, May 2011

Franklin Templeton Distributors, Inc. One Franklin Parkway, San Mateo, CA 94403.

content.title: Increases in disposable income = Increases in global consumerism
content.content: One of the new favorite pastimes in China is shopping.  While the Chinese are known for being excellent savers, they are brand lovers, not unlike the famous Japanese luxury shoppers.  While the number of Chinese shoppers who can afford luxury goods is still quite small as a percentage of the 1.3 billion Chinese populous, it is growing rapidly.  Luxury goods companies are rapidly expanding across Chinese cities, enjoying rapid growth, which we expect to continue as the country continues to develop. In fact,we are participating in this consumer growth across several aspects of retail, including global grocery and general merchandise and do-it-yourself home stores which we have long followed and which are now expanding in China.
content.quote: “It seems to be common sense that if you are going to search for these unusually good bargains, you wouldn’t just search the United States.” —Sir John Templeton, November 1979

quiz.question: Japan: #1 in luxury sales. Who’ll be #1 in 2015?

answerInfo.title: China Loves Luxury
answerInfo.message: By 2015, China is expected to claim the top spot with luxury sales of $27B.

quiz.source: Source: McKinsey Global Institute, March 2011

content.title: Increases in disposable income = Increases in global consumerism
content.content: It’s been over 20 years since the Berlin wall came tumbling down.  During that time, Eastern Europe has undergone an amazing transformation.  Poland has been at the vanguard of this change and quickly risen in economic stature.  In fact, during the global financial crisis, it was the only European Union country that did not fall into recession.<sup>1</sup>
content.quote: Franklin Templeton was recognized for selling funds in more markets than any other asset manager.<sup>2</sup>

quiz.question: Who does the World Bank consider “high income”?

answerInfo.title: The Poles Have It.
answerInfo.message: However Turkey and Romania are both upper middle income.

quiz.source: Source: The World Bank, August 2011

content.title: More cars. More construction.
content.content: When I first visited Singapore in the 1960s, the country was poor by global standards, with a per capita gross domestic product of only $395.1 Today, it is hard to imagine that was ever the case.  Now it’s a glistening global business hub and the people there have prospered.  In fact, it has the highest percentage of millionaire households in the world.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has been recognized as a leading asset manager in Asia.

quiz.question: Who has the most city dwellers as a % of pop.?

answerInfo.title: Singapore City Life
answerInfo.message: 100% of the population of Singapore lives in a major metropolitan area.

quiz.source: Source: The World Bank (World Development Indicators); United Nations, World Urbanization Prospects, 12/31/09.

content.title: More cars. More construction.
content.content: Some people may measure China’s progress by the number of iPhones they are buying there, but I’ve seen it play out more dramatically in infrastructure growth.  The Chinese are becoming more urban and that means they need more power plants, more mass transit, and more high-rise apartments.  They are tapping companies around the world to help them build.
content.quote: Dr. Mark Mobius discusses infrastructure improvements occurring worldwide in his latest blog posting — Urbanization: Building a New World

quiz.question: # of cities in China with 1 mil+ people by 2025?

answerInfo.title: China Builds Up
answerInfo.message: 221 cities are expected to have 1 mil+ people by 2025. Europe has 35 today.

quiz.source: Source: McKinsey Global Institute, Preparing for China’s Urban Billion, March 2009.

content.title: More cars. More construction.
content.content: Technology is a game-changer when it comes to creating opportunities.  You don’t have to live in the country with the most natural resources or the most people in order to innovate.  You just have to have the smarts and the imagination to create what people want and need.  That could be a social media website or it could be the next breakthrough in pharmaceuticals.  We look everywhere for companies whose potential hasn’t yet been broadly appreciated.
content.quote: Dr. Mark Mobius discusses infrastructure improvements occurring worldwide in his latest blog posting — Urbanization: Building a New World

quiz.question: Where’s business R&D spending highest (% of GDP)?

answerInfo.title: Israel Does Its R&D
answerInfo.message: Israel spends 4.86% of its GDP on R&D, followed by Sweden and Finland. US is #6.

quiz.source: Source: The World Bank (World Development Indicators); United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization (UNESCO); Institute for Statistics. Data as of 12/31/2008.

content.title: More cars. More construction.
content.content: One truly global phenomenon is the aspiration to buy a home.  As the ranks of the middle class around the world grow, buying real estate is usually high on their list of goals.  This is true in Asia, where people especially value home ownership.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has specialized, independent managers that offer diverse investment solutions across multiple asset classes

quiz.question: Who has the highest rate of home ownership?

answerInfo.title: Home Sweet Bulgaria
answerInfo.message: Bulgaria has a 98% home ownership rate, compared to 74% in the U.S.

quiz.source: Source: The World Bank (World Development Indicators). Data as of each country’s most recent census.

content.title: The World is Resource Hungry – Growth fuels further consumption
content.content: While there may be a lot of talk about energy independence, without some radical shift in policy and dramatic increases in efficiency, it will be a while before the U.S. can supply all of its fuel needs. And because oil markets are truly global, ripples made in one part of the world are likely to continue to impact the price you pay at the pump.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has over 540 investment professionals worldwide.<sup>2</sup>

quiz.question: Who is the largest supplier of oil to the U.S.?

answerInfo.title: Pipe Line, eh?
answerInfo.message: Over 20% of total U.S. oil imports come from Canada.

quiz.source: Source: U.S. Energy Information Administration, July 2011.

content.title: The World is Resource Hungry – Growth fuels further consumption
content.content: The rapid pace of infrastructure construction is fueling demand for resources like copper. We’ve seen the price of copper quadruple over the last decade as it’s being used in wiring, plumbing and electronics around the globe.
content.quote: “The only investors who shouldn't diversify are those who are right 100% of the time.” —Sir John Templeton, 1983

card.name: Claus Born, CFA
card.title: Investment Analyst
card.company: Templeton Emerging Markets Group, Buenos Aires<sup>1</sup>

quiz.question: Who is the world’s largest copper exporter?

answerInfo.title: Chile Shines
answerInfo.message: Global demand for copper is on the rise and Chile exports more of it than anyone.

quiz.source: Sources: London Metal Exchange, 6/30/11 and The World Bureau of Metal Statistics, 1/31/11.

content.title: The World is Resource Hungry – Growth fuels further consumption
content.content: When people consider the world’s most precious liquids, oil often comes to mind, but none is more precious than water. Advances in desalination, or turning salt water into drinkable water, are playing an important role in addressing water demands through much of the Middle East. Water is becoming big business.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has 12 local asset management teams providing domestic products in other parts of the world, including the MENA region.

quiz.question: How much water is needed to make 1 cup of coffee?

answerInfo.title: Never Just One Cup
answerInfo.message: On avg., the entire process to make 1 cup of coffee requires 549 cups of water! Source: UNESCO-IHE Institute for Water Education, 12/31/10.

quiz.source: Sources: London Metal Exchange, 6/30/11 and The World Bureau of Metal Statistics, 1/31/11.

content.title: The World is Resource Hungry – Growth fuels further consumption
content.content: As countries grow economically, they tend to spend more on healthcare.  It’s a natural progression.  In many developing countries their spending on healthcare is only a fraction of what it is in the U.S. and Europe.  That is changing, and it will mean big opportunities for pharmaceutical companies and other companies in the healthcare industry.
content.quote: In a blog posting titled Africa: Challenges and Outlook, Dr. Mark Mobius gives his perspective on changes taking place in the region.

quiz.question: Whose healthcare spend is growing the fastest?

answerInfo.title: Angola Gets Healthy
answerInfo.message: Angola’s per capita spend over the last 10 yrs has grown the fastest at 37%.

quiz.source: Source: The World Bank-2011: World Development Indicators: World Health Organization National Health Account Database, based on healthcare expenditure per capita for 10-year period ended 12/31/2009.

content.title: The World is Connected — Economies and people are interdependent.
content.content: Social media is continuing its evolution from just being a fun way to share with friends. It’s becoming a powerful way for companies to advertise, develop their brand and drive sales. Just like 10-15 years ago many companies were scrambling to put up websites, today, many are working to develop a social media strategy.
content.quote: Franklin Templeton has offices in 34 countries around the world.<sup>2</sup>

quiz.question: What % of Facebook users live outside the U.S.?

answerInfo.title: World Wide Facebook
answerInfo.message: Of the 750 million current Facebook users, 525 million live outside of the U.S.

quiz.source: Source: ©Facebook, August 2011.

content.title: The World is Connected — Economies and people are interdependent.
content.content: It’s easy to assume that most everyone is on the internet in today’s world. The fact is, that less than half of the world is on the web. That means there’s still lots of room for growth in telecommunications infrastructure. We’re even seeing some countries skip running data cables and focusing on wireless.
content.quote: The number of Franklin Templeton investment professionals has grown from 243 in 2000 to over 540 today.<sup>2</sup>

quiz.question: Who has a higher % of pop. using the internet?

answerInfo.title: Norway is Online
answerInfo.message: Norway ranked 2<sup>nd</sup>, Lux 6<sup>th</sup> and Ireland 31<sup>st</sup>

quiz.source: Source: The World Bank (World Development Indicators), ITU (International Telecommunication Union), 12/31/09.

content.title: The World is Connected — Economies and people are interdependent.
content.content: A great portion of Europe’s GDP comes from exports, where many European companies derive a significant portion of their earnings and profits from regions outside Europe. These companies may be domiciled in Europe and listed on European equity markets, but are very global in nature. In fact, many European exporters derive between 25 and 75% of their revenues and earnings from other areas of the world which are experiencing high growth.
content.quote: At Franklin Templeton, risk management is integrated within our fundamental, research-driven approach.

quiz.question: Which country exports more?

answerInfo.title: Germany is Exporting
answerInfo.message: Germany is Europe’s top exporter with over $1.3 trillion and trails only China.

quiz.source: Source: The World Factbook 2011. Washington, D.C: Central Intelligence Agency, 2011.

legal: WHAT ARE THE RISKS?

All investments involve risks. Special risks are associated with foreign investing, including currency fluctuations, economic instability and political developments. Investments in developing markets involve heightened risks related to the same factors, in addition to those associated with these markets’ smaller size and lesser liquidity. These and other risk considerations are discussed in a fund’s prospectus.

Investors should carefully consider a fund’s investment goals, risks, charges and expenses before investing. Download a summary prospectus and/or prospectus, which contains this and other information. Please carefully read a prospectus before you invest or send money.

Portfolio manager comments above do not represent a complete analysis of every material fact regarding any country, market, industry, security or fund. Because market and economic conditions are subject to change, comments, opinions and analyses may change without notice. A portfolio manager’s assessment of a particular security, investment or strategy is not intended as individual investment advice or a recommendation or solicitation to buy, sell or hold any security or to adopt any investment strategy; it is intended only to provide insight into the fund’s portfolio selection process. Holdings are subject to change.
Franklin Templeton Distributors, Inc. One Franklin Parkway, San Mateo, CA 94403.

content.title: The World is Connected — Economies and people are interdependent.
content.content: In China, the cost of solar energy is expected to decline over the next several years. In the next decade, the cost of providing solar-generated electricity is projected to match the current price of electricity today. The point where these two lines cross will mark the beginning of a new era where solar energy has the potential to be used on a very large scale. That’s critical for a country like China with large and growing energy needs.
content.quote: The Templeton Emerging Markets Group includes 49 investment professionals, representing 26 nationalities and speaking 24 languages.<sup>2</sup>

quiz.question: Who produces more renewable electricity?

answerInfo.title: China is Charged Up
answerInfo.message: China has made renewable energy a keystone of its energy policy.

quiz.source: Source : U.S. Energy Information Administration, 12/31/09.
